intro: Lellingeria pseudomitchelliae, commonly known as the Mitchell's false cypress, is a rare and unique plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Cupressaceae family, which includes cypresses and junipers. This plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and its ability to form dense, shrub-like growth. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
